channel.title: BBC News - US & Canada

item.title: Afghanistan: Diplomats hasten exit as Taliban near Kabul
item.description: US troops arrive to help with evacuation efforts as militants seize a city an hour's drive from Kabul.

item.title: Climate change: July world's hottest month ever - US agency
item.description: US scientists say July's land and ocean temperature was 0.93C (1.68F) above the 20th Century average.

item.title: Three Florida educators die of Covid, says union
item.description: They are said to have died from Covid-19 related complications - days before the school year begins.

item.title: Nicki Minaj and husband Kenneth Petty sued by sex assault victim
item.description: The woman claims the couple harassed her to try to make her recant accusations against Kenneth Petty.

item.title: US census: Hispanic and Asian-American driving US population growth
item.description: Newly released data points to sluggish population growth and a more multiracial US.

item.title: Britney Spears' father to step down as conservator
item.description: Jamie Spears pledges to take part in an "orderly transition" but doesn't say when that will happen.

item.title: Can Americans pull the plug on petrol-powered cars?
item.description: Joe Biden wants half of all cars sold in the US to be zero emission by 2030 - but getting there won't be easy.

item.title: Satanic forums visited by a killer uncovered
item.description: The BBC uncovers evidence about Satanic forums visited by the killer of two sisters.

item.title: How North American cities are bracing for more heatwaves
item.description: Local governments are getting creative when it comes to tackling frequent and extreme heat.

item.title: Kathy Hochul: Who is New York's first female governor?
item.description: The history-making Democrat will take the role after Andrew Cuomo resigned over harassment claims.

item.title: Biden's unlikely plan to use roads to fight racism
item.description: An infrastructure package that seeks to address inequality gets a mixed reception on the ground.

item.title: Covid: Canada opens its border to vaccinated Americans
item.description: We asked Canadians how they feel about the move, which lifts a pandemic-long restriction.

item.title: Infrastructure bill: $1tn for clean energy, internet, trains and more
item.description: The $1tn bill takes aim at issues from buckling bridges to global warming and remote working.

item.title: Fenty Beauty: How make-up helped Rihanna become a billionaire
item.description: Rihanna makes more money from her make-up than from her music and acting work.

item.title: Olympic medals: An alternative table - with US 15th
item.description: How would the medals table look if population and wealth were taken into account?

item.title: Abba Kyari: The Nigerian super sleuth wanted in the US
item.description: Highly decorated policeman Abba Kyari's reputation is under scrutiny over alleged fraud.

item.title: Mayflower 400 years: How many people are related to the Mayflower pilgrims?
item.description: For some, the17th century "pilgrim fathers" are also real-life ancestors. But for how many?

item.title: Ryan Reynolds: Why Free Guy is more than a 'video game movie'
item.description: The Canadian actor's latest film sees him play a different kind of "naïve and innocent" character.

item.title: US expands citizenship for children born abroad in win for same-sex couples
item.description: Children born through surrogacy or IVF can now qualify, even without being related to the US parent.

item.title: Tucker Carlson: What the Fox News host is doing in Hungary
item.description: The controversial news host is the latest high-profile ally of Hungary's embattled prime minister.

item.title: Covid crashed Obama's party - should Delta change your plans?
item.description: As Covid changes Obama's birthday plans we ask experts what the virus surge means for your summer.

item.title: Andrew Cuomo: Why is the NY Governor under pressure to resign?
item.description: Democrats, including President Biden, have called for the New York governor to go.

item.title: Simone Biles 'shows how much gymnastics has changed'
item.description: Biles' withdrawal shows how attitudes have changed, says former USA gymnast Dominique Moceanu.

item.title: Covid third wave: Americans 'scared and angry' as pandemic worsens
item.description: As the Delta variant causes a rethink about risk, Americans are battling to keep a feeling of normalcy.

item.title: Bennifer 2.0: How Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck got us talking again
item.description: How a viral photo of Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck exposed the internet's lust for nostalgia.

item.title: Are America's unvaccinated changing their minds?
item.description: Timothy lives in a county where only a third are fully jabbed - he says he regrets his choice now.

item.title: Vauhxx Booker: Black man condemns charges over alleged race attack
item.description: Vauhxx Booker, who alleges two white men threatened to lynch him, is himself charged with assault.

item.title: Why black TikTok creators have gone on strike
item.description: Backlash for "cultural appropriation" on the video-making app may mean no viral dances for a while.

item.title: How US police training compares with the rest of the world
item.description: Amid calls to improve training in the US, we examine how it compares with other developed countries.

item.title: Global heating: Study shows impact of 'climate racism' in US
item.description: Black people in the US are subject to double the level of heat stress in cities than whites.

item.title: Growing hate crime against Asian Americans
item.description: The BBC's Michelle Fleury looks at the problem of hate crime directed at Asian Americans in the US.

item.title: George Floyd death: How do I talk to my son about race?
item.description: A year on from the death of George Floyd, BBC presenter Eddie Nestor examines his role as a father.

item.title: The couple inspired by Tulsa’s black entrepreneurs
item.description: Obum and his wife Faith moved to Tulsa in 2019, inspired by the legacy of 'Black Wall Street'.

item.title: Tulsa Massacre: 'Our country may forget this history, but I cannot'
item.description: Viola Fletcher, a survivor of the 1921 Tulsa Massacre, calls for justice 100 years on.

item.title: Tulsa massacre: The search for victims, 100 years on
item.description: Decades after white mobs razed an affluent black neighbourhood the search for bodies goes on.

item.title: George Floyd death: How US police are trying to win back trust
item.description: A year after George Floyd's death, it's not just civilians who'll be reflecting on what happened.

item.title: Covid: Biden to continue Trump's Title 42 migrant expulsions
item.description: The White House plans to continue the controversial Title 42 policy to help combat Covid-19.

item.title: Immigration: Is US-Mexico border seeing a surge in migrants?
item.description: Donald Trump says migrants are crossing the border like the US "has never seen". We've checked the numbers.

item.title: 'Our first day of freedom on American soil'
item.description: Adrian Meza and his family from Nicaragua have just been released from detention by US border officials.

item.title: 'Heartbreaking' conditions in US migrant child camp
item.description: An investigation by the BBC has uncovered alarming conditions at a child migrant camp in Texas.

item.title: US migrant camp 'kids feel like they're in prison'
item.description: More than 2,000 migrant children are being detained in an overcrowded camp in Texas ridden with disease.

item.title: Mexico: Risking everything for an American dream
item.description: Thousands of migrants from Central America are making an arduous journey to the US border.

item.title: Children speak of neglect in US asylum camps
item.description: The BBC has uncovered allegations of cold temperatures, sickness, lice and abuse, through a series of interviews with children and staff at US detention camps for children.

item.title: Colombia: Migrants risking it all to cross Darien Gap
item.description: It takes up to 20 days, and can be deadly – but everyday hundreds try to cross the border between Panama and Colombia.

item.title: Guatemala: Suffocated youth unafraid of a deadly journey
item.description: Tougher policies and deaths on the road are unlikely to stop Guatemalans from trying to reach the US.

item.title: 'Can you help me?' Boy found alone at the border
item.description: A 10-year-old from Nicaragua woke up to find he had been abandoned by his group.

item.title: Kamala Harris visits US border amid migrant crisis
item.description: The US vice-president appeals for an end to "finger-pointing" amid a bipartisan backlash.

item.title: What is Biden doing differently at US border?
item.description: Democrat Joe Biden has promised to undo many of Donald Trump's immigration policies.

item.title: Big rise in numbers of migrant children on Mexico-US border
item.description: The increase from 380 to nearly 3,500 has overwhelmed local facilities in Mexico, the UN warns.

item.title: Child migrants: The challenges facing Biden at the US-Mexico border
item.description: A surge in migrants arriving at the US-Mexico border tests the administration's immigration promises.

item.title: Back to school triggers US fury over masks for students
item.description: With Covid cases rising, Americans are divided over how students should return to the classroom.

item.title: 'Hurt' Andrew Cuomo addresses daughters as he quits
item.description: The New York governor steps down amid allegations he sexually harassed multiple women.

item.title: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo resigns in wake of harassment report
item.description: The Democrat says he will step aside after an inquiry found he sexually harassed multiple women.

item.title: Andrew Cuomo: The allegations and his 'I kiss people' defence
item.description: The NY governor shows photos of him kissing and hugging people as he denies sexual misconduct claims.

item.title: CDC director Rochelle Walensky says vaccines worked in Provincetown
item.description: Rochelle Walensky says vaccines protected Provincetown amid an "immense amount of exposure".

item.title: Key moments from first hearing of Capitol riot inquiry
item.description: Police officers gave emotional testimony about their struggles during the riot to US lawmakers.

item.title: Canada residential schools: 'Six years old, I was imprisoned here'
item.description: As searches for unmarked graves continue, survivors reflect on a dark legacy of residential schools.

item.title: Capitol Hill police officer in tears during testimony
item.description: Officer Gonell gave an emotional statement during the first day of the US Capitol riot inquiry.

item.title: Wildfires spread from California to Nevada
item.description: Fire crews are battling extreme temperatures to control wildfires in California and Nevada.

item.title: Hemingway 'lookalike' chosen in Florida contest
item.description: A 63-year-old won the Key West, Florida contest for his likeness to the award-winning author.

item.title: US fires: Inside a US fire truck driving through a wildfire
item.description: As burning ash pelts their vehicle, video shows firefighters in California drive through the flames.

item.title: Moment New York mum saves five-year-old from kidnap
item.description: The mother pulled her son from a car after he was taken from her in broad daylight in the New York City.

item.title: Powerful fire tornado in California is latest extreme weather sign
item.description: The vortex of smoke and flame is one of the latest signs of extreme weather threatening the US West.

item.title: Miami building collapse: 'People went to sleep, and then they died'
item.description: Both the mother and grandmother of Pablo Rodríguez were in the building when it fell. Now, he wants answers.

item.title: The Yankees' 70-year-old bat girl
item.description: Decades after she was told girls couldn't do the job, she got a chance to live her childhood dream.

item.title: Los Angeles fireworks explosion: Truck goes up in flames as police seize fireworks
item.description: A truck filled with 2,000kg of fireworks goes up in flames, injuring at least 17 people in Los Angeles.

item.title: Katty Kay: How 100 days turned into five years of fun
item.description: Katty Kay leaves the BBC after nearly three decades of service, including five years on Beyond 100 Days.

item.title: 'It's the craziest thing I ever heard in my life'
item.description: This video was sent by one of the first eyewitnesses on the scene of the Miami building collapse.

item.title: Miami building collapse: 'I'm not losing my hope'
item.description: As search and rescue efforts continue, friends and family desperately await signs from the missing.

item.title: Katty Kay: 'It's been a privilege to sit in this chair'
item.description: Legendary anchor Katty Kay signs off from the BBC for the final time.

item.title: Why US millennials are quitting big cities
item.description: Remote workers are freer than ever to relocate, especially when smaller cities dangle incentives.

item.title: Runaway cows escape California meatpacking plant
item.description: About 40 cows made a run for it and wandered through the town of Pico Rivera.

item.title: Biden: Insurrectionists 'need nukes' to take on US government
item.description: The president says rebels would need more than guns to take on the nuclear-armed US government.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi: 'Sanctity of the vote is very much in peril'
item.description: The House speaker tells the BBC that American democracy is in peril if voting rights reform fails.

item.title: New York mayoral election: What voters want from a new mayor
item.description: Learn what's at stake as voters head to the polls to choose a new leader for New York City.

item.title: Canada 'Sixties Scoop': Indigenous survivors map out their stories
item.description: Canada's "Sixties Scoop" saw thousands of indigenous children forcibly removed from their families.

item.title: New Christmas campaign for Canadians held in China
item.description: The campaign is based on efforts around a similar case involving a British journalist fifty years ago.

item.title: New Brunswick outbreak: How a smalltown doctor became a Covid pariah
item.description: After being labelled "patient zero", a small-town physician in Canada was shunned.
